page.title: 08History,Religion Kinmel Hall
page.content: This beautiful building stands in park land and was built a few hundred yards from the original Kinmel dating 1333. The present building was erected in 1842, extended in 1871. It has survived a chequered life from being the private home of various important families, a Boys' School, Rheuma Spa Military Hospital, Clinic, and a Girls' School which ended with a disa- strous fire in 1975 when the building was almost gutted. Kinmel Hall was leased by the owner to the Kinmel Hall Trust in 1979 and rebuilt at a cost of Â£2 million, funded by a business man with property interests, the Welsh Office and various grants. Most of the work was done by a small group of Christian enthusiasts. It is now a Christian Conference Centre which can accommodate 500 people. It has all the amenities of a 1st class hotel.
